item.title: US judge blocks Trump administration from halting Snap food benefits
item.description: A federal judge said the plan to suspend food aid to millions of Americans during the ongoing US government shutdown is likely unlawful.

item.title: Several hundred feared dead as Tanzania election protests continue
item.description: A diplomatic source tells the BBC there is credible evidence that at least 500 people had died.

item.title: 'No inch here was spared': Hurricane Melissa destroys Jamaica town
item.description: The BBCâ€™s Nada Tawfik reports from Black River, where the strongest storm to hit the country in modern history has left scenes of desperation.

item.title: More than 60,000 flee Sudanese city after its capture by RSF militia, says UN
item.description: El-Fasher is under the control of paramilitaries accused of mass executions and crimes against humanity.

item.title: Canada's Carney to visit Xi in China, marking 'turning point' in relations
item.description: Finding it hard to reach a resolution of its trade dispute with the US after Trump suspended talks, Canada turns to other major economies.
